website_summaries.verdict: This power strip is smart, but "Genius" might be pushing it. Even though it has only one socket, for now we still prefer the Belkin WeMo Switch.
pros: The Quirky Pivot Power Genius power strip features a fun, useful design
The free Wink app that you'll use to control it is wonderfully well thought out, making automation a breeze
cons: The Genius only has four total outlets -- fewer than the average power strip
Also, aside from basic scheduling, your only triggering option is the Quirky Spotter, which was an inconsistent performer in our tests

customer_reviews.title: These USED to work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: These used to work with Alexa through Wink but that is no longer the case. I had three that worked flawlessly until I accidentally deleted them while migrating a lot off new smart lights. Turns out that when I added them to Alexa almost two years ago they worked but something was changed in the api or firmware in the Alexa app and it no longer works. Your results may be different but don't be surprised one day when you update a router or move done smart things around if it doesn't work with Alexa any more.
customer_reviews.author: dbvolfan1

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely zero product documentation.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to get this to connect pretty easily to my Wink hub. But Alexa could not discover it. Okay, there's apparently a skill I learn from the reviews (not like there's any documentation). Install the skill. It needs an account. Amazon account? No. Wink account? No. It needs a Quirky account. Download the Quirky app (yes there is an entire app for a relatively cheap power strip). Create an account. Enable the skill. Still no Alexa discovery. Gave up and returned it. What's annoying is that I have no idea if this product is defective, or if I missed something, because there is Absolutely Zero Documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Saaz T.

customer_reviews.title: No requires $4.99 subscription fee monthly for any smart features
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product, but on short notice (May 2020, 2 weeks notice), Wink has announced you must pay $4.99 monthly to have access to the device. This includes other integrations with other smart home systems and hubs. Unfortunately, this kills the value, particularly considering no new features, products, or integrations have been introduced in years
customer_reviews.author: Justin D Berger

customer_reviews.title: A once good product, ruined by another subscription fee.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this 3 years ago for $20, it didn't require a subscription fee to use the smart outlet. Back then, I would have recommended the product. Now, it's not worth the money. It's an oversized bulky surge protector with no smart capabilities unless you want to pay a monthly fee. I don't know about you, but I'm not gonna pay $5 a month to turn my fan on at night. Especially when there are other affordable smart outlet options without a subscription. If they ever decide to take away the subscription fee, we can rediscuss the matter. The subscription fee is the only thing making it an immediate 1-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: What a rip off.  Monthly fee AFTER  you buy item!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy any WINK products. They charge a fee on top of the price just to control and do what others offer for free. I was one of the first to buy these years ago, and supported this company. Now, they want me to pay 5 bucks a month to control my items. This is a bait and switch rip off. I will be biying their competitors products going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Geek

customer_reviews.title: Predatory payment model for basic functionality
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi features of the power strip now cost a $5 monthly subscription. That's ABSURD, for reference Nintendo's online service can cost as low as that for a YEAR, and I'm sure they're processing 100x as much data.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported by wifi
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for years, and they were great with Alexa. However, now they no longer work. They don't connect to my WiFi and Alexa can no longer find them to control the outlets. So they are now just regular surge protectors. I've contacted customer service multiple times and they are either not responsive or cannot fix the issue. I'm not sure exactly what happened, but they do not function as they once did.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Kay

customer_reviews.title: Now a paid subscription
customer_reviews.text: This works with the Wink app which just recently transferred to a paid subscription. So unless you want to pay $5 a month, this device is now useless. Such a crock.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen H.

customer_reviews.title: It's now completely worthless
customer_reviews.text: Now as of 5/13/2020 they have made this thing completely worthless. I can't use it unless I play for their subscription which is a ridiculous $5 per month.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa and WInk app but not with Google home
customer_reviews.text: Works with Alexa and WInk app but not with Google home. Google home is my primary method of controlling my home automation devices and I was disappointed that I couldn't get it to work. It connected to my Wink controller (version 1) very quickly. I was able to control the first two sockets individually as expected. I was also able to turn them off/on independently via Amazon Echo. But Google Home assistant doesn't see them so I'm out of luck there. It cost them two stars in my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I had a really hard time getting this to connect to wifi until I read a review written by a 9-year-old who advised plugging it in as close as possible to the wifi router. Once I did that, and Wink recognized my Wifi, then I could unplug the Power Genius and move it to wherever I needed it. I am using it with my Echo and my Alexa app. Love it so far, but I had to be patient and keep trying to connect.
customer_reviews.author: School Mom

customer_reviews.title: Finally Does What The Product Page Claims (Works with Alexa)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 2: It's working with Alexa again! Glad they fixed it. Changing review to 4 stars (with add the 5th if compatibility continues for at least the next 6 months. UPDATE: I was able to get it to work through IFTTT, but that's a stretch to include "Works with Amazon Alexa" in the title if I have to sign up for a separate service and link my Amazon and Wink accounts to that service, then add a custom script. I love my Pivot Power, but unfortunately after 45 minutes of trying, I’ve concluded that it will not work with Amazon Echo. I’ve downloaded the Alexa app, and linked my Wink account. It finds everything except the Pivot Power.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Smart plug even for bulk chargers
customer_reviews.text: I love it ! I am so enthusiastic about WINK and it line of products that adding this make this product 10 time more worthy. Why? Because it is not just smart, it is part of a system that combines features which makes our life somehow less stressful. Using time and detection, the "Robots" do by themselves whatever we should have taken the time to do. Remember that the setup will need a firmware update. Make sure you use a guest network with a simple password, otherwise installation can fail. Would strongly recommend to who has a Wink system
customer_reviews.author: HELIO

customer_reviews.title: Easy install for Wink 2
customer_reviews.text: Paired easily to the Wink 2. Able to control the two remote outlets without any issues. After a recent FLorida thunderstorm (which can be quite severe) I had to reassign the hub to a different network - to get the Quirky/GE strip working again, all I had to do was remove it from the hub and re-install it - very simple. Note that when removing and reinstalling the strip (or any other device) you should note your existing Robots and Schedules for that device so that you can recreate them.
customer_reviews.author: TRDad

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but may not work...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one of these about a year ago, and it works fine. Ordered a second one, and never could get it to work. Called Wink support, and we were unable to get it working. Wink advised the company that made is no longer in business, and some of any available inventory may have older​ code and can't be successfully updated. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT. No need for a hub and works with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. For the price there is nothing like this on the market. I love that I have two different smart plugs that I can connect to within my WINK app. It was easy to setup and worked great. I want to order 10 more for my friends and use around the house. Here is the best part: you don't need a hub! That is huge. I was able to give these to family members for christmas and not worry that they don't have a hub. My sister and my dad easily set up their strip to be used with Alexa. "Alexa, turn on the living room lamp" and bam! Great great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Wink is a black eye.
customer_reviews.text: *** updated *** I no longer recommend anything Wink sells. Customers will now have to pay for a Wink subscription every month to maintain functionality - including those who already own Wink products. The subscription fee goes into effect on 5/13/2020. All Wink products will no longer offer “smart” functionality as of that date without paying the subscription fee. I love these things for scheduling events. They work with Alexa as well, if you add the software plug-in which is very easy to do. I own five. Of those, two of them have buttons that don't work, but do you follow instruction based on programming, so I never made a return
customer_reviews.author: B Extra

customer_reviews.title: Only had a problem like twice in about 2 months of consistent use
customer_reviews.text: Only had a problem like twice in about 2 months of consistent use. Very nice, easy way to automate a lamp that has multiple bulbs in it Edit: It's now November, and it's broken. Doesn't work at all, in the past Alexa would turn it on immediately, now the power strip doesn't receive any signals.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: but with excellent phone support from Wink
customer_reviews.text: This the least expensive WiFi outlet I have been able to find. Was a little tricky to program it using my Samsung phone (it is apparently easier to set up with iPhone), but with excellent phone support from Wink, was able to program it. Bought it for the Christmas tree and loved it so much, bought a second one to control the lamps in each of the kid's rooms--they never turn their lights off!! But that's not a problem now, they are all on scheduled programs to turn off at specific times each day and each night.
customer_reviews.author: PhysTher2001

customer_reviews.title: No Luck For Me Getting It To Work
customer_reviews.text: We were unsuccessful in getting past the initial setup - connecting device to the Wink app. Attempted over 12 times using two phones. Settings for wifi were correct, and I confirmed my router is using 2.4 Ghz bandwidth as recommended, but app would always end without connecting to the device. Too bad as I really wanted to get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Shortwaver

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, and we own a few of these
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, and we own a few of these. Even as "dumb" power adapters they're nice. But the make flaw is the huge plug - it's hard to get into anywhere that isn't a perfectly flat surface. We have a recessed outlet behind our TV and the plug on this is too big to fit, so I can't use it there. The other flaw is the really weak wifi antenna (and why wifi?) -- unlessa very strong signal near the plug, it won't get a reception. It integrates nicely with ifttt and Alexa via the Wink app, though, once you get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: Effectively bricked my device due to subscription model
customer_reviews.text: It was very mediocre when I first purchased this power strip as it would constantly disconnect and not work properly. However, now that their model is subscription based, it makes any of their products useless. I can no longer control the power strip that I paid a pricey premium for (due to obvious smart home usage) and they effectively bricked my device unless I fork over more money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed and more
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! Well-designed, easy to set up, no hub required, app is super clean and useful, and I had my lights & fan set up in minutes. Now not only can I say "turn on the fan" or "turn off the room lights" and have them magically respond, I can even have the lights turn off automatically if I'm out of the house for 30 minutes or more; one of the unexpected (and ultra customizable) bonuses you get with the app's easy automation shortcuts. I might just fill my house with these
customer_reviews.author: Jesse J Holden

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 2.4 connection (not 5.0)
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly & easy set up. The only issue is that it doesn't work with a 5.0 connection. I tried over & over to get it to connect and it kept saying it couldn't (and it wasn't readily apparent what the problem was). Then I tried my 2.4 connection, and it connected. I bought 2, and the 2nd one set up took about 3 minutes. Used the Wink app. Connected to Alexa Echo. I can't believe how cheap this thing is! All other Smart plugs are at least $35.
customer_reviews.author: J. Finn

customer_reviews.title: subscription service out of the blue and no longer can use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for Alexa for 3 years now to control our lamps. Now they want 4.99 a month to use it with alexa... don't buy
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Won't even power up unless WiFi connected (no Hotspots!)
customer_reviews.text: Oh oh...Love my other Quirky Pivot Power outlets that I own but didn't realize that this one is a GE co-branded smart power strip. I unwittingly brought it with me for a business trip only to realize upon arrival that this power strip doesn't work at all, IE could not power my devices, because it needed to be able to connect with the hotel WiFi. This won't work on hotspots. This might be great for some people but unusable for travel. I need to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this product and it arrived less than an hour ago. Shipping was fast and the packaging was really well done. It felt like an Apple unboxing. Setup was easy and now I have 2 additional outlets for my alexa to control. For the price, I don't understand how they do it, I'm tempted to order more for myself and order one for everyone else I know who has an Amazon echo.
customer_reviews.author: Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: Great features on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to control amplifiers in a whole house audio setup, and it works great! The app is simple enough, and I was able to get IFTTT set up very easily. The programming is a little wonky (I had to do it a couple of times), but it works and you only need to get it set up once. It's also very cost effective, giving you 2 individually controllable outlets for about 40% less than a single Belkin outlet!
customer_reviews.author: David E. Still

customer_reviews.title: Works great even if it was possibly a returned item that they sold as new.
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving 4 stars because there was evidence that the box had been opened and was possibly a returned item from someone else. It had been re taped and the there was no wire tie on the cable, even though you could tell by the shape of the cord (bent) that it had been wire tied at some point. It took about 6 times for me to finally get this device paired up with my Wink hub, but it has worked flawlessly since . So even if it had been a returned item I am OK with it.
customer_reviews.author: paratwa

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product during the holidays in order to operate my Christmas tree and it was perfect. One month later, the WiFi connect portion will not work. I read all the blogs and even connect customer support but it still does not work. I would wait until they improve the technology on this product before buying.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: I have several other Quirky extension cords and really looked forward to getting this one. I wish it had worked. I could only get the Bluetooth/Internet connection (not really sure what it was) to connect once, for about 1.5 minutes. Without that connection, 2 of the 4 outlets will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L.

customer_reviews.title: These power strips are wonderful, and easily compatible with Wink home automation
customer_reviews.text: These power strips are wonderful, and easily compatible with Wink home automation. I have one smart outlet connected to my coffee maker and another to my crock pot. That way I can control either remotely. (When I wake up in the morning, I command Google Home to "make coffee," which turns on the outlet where my coffee maker is setup.)
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: The outlets would not sync to my samsung/android devices at all! I was unable to get any customer service help from the Quirky Co. because they no longer exist and all of their phone numbers are out of service! I was, however, able to contact the Wink App customer service agents, but they were no help either. Stop selling this product on Amazon IMMEDIATELY... it's garbage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: SCAM rip off
customer_reviews.text: RIP off, I purchased years ago and worked good until Quirky decided to recently charge 5.00 a month for the remote function I purchased this for. SCAM
customer_reviews.author: Rita Finnegan

customer_reviews.title: 2 plug unit. The "wifi" is no go. Criminals
customer_reviews.text: this is criminal. 4 plug outlet with only 2 that work. You have to pay $5 a month to get the 2 outlets to work. Cant even turn them on without wifi. Straight trash!
customer_reviews.author: Gat

customer_reviews.title: This product integrated easily into my WINK home automation setup
customer_reviews.text: This product integrated easily into my WINK home automation setup. One thing I did notice, when I connected it to my Wink Hub I could not move it to another outlet, I had to sync with the hub using the outlet where the strip would be used. Very easy to program, I am using it to control the outside Christmas lights this year.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. jamian

customer_reviews.title: Great value for cost
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase if it lasts. Setup was really easy. You get two controllable outlets which have their own on /off buttons on the side and two powered all the time outlets. For the money this is a best buy for plug in automation. I'm thinking about ordering couple more. It seems that the WiFi receiver has good strength. I was replacing a wemo outlet that I had a hard time getting to stay connected because it had a crappy reception. This power strip had no problems receiving a good signal.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R Hallgren

customer_reviews.title: Great product overall
customer_reviews.text: That pairing method with the blinking lights is weird af, but it works consistently and has IFTTT integration. At this low price for two controllable ports its difficult to go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Carlton

customer_reviews.title: sync did not work with iPhone X
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to sync and configure the power strip to work with Wink hub/app using a iPhone X. The lights never turned GREEN. For a few seconds it flashed RED and then went back to blinking ORANGE. There was no information on the FAQ page on the website about this issue. Then I tried the sync process using a iPhone 7, and it was able to configure properly.
customer_reviews.author: EverythingAmazon

customer_reviews.title: When connected it works great with the echo
customer_reviews.text: When connected it works great with the echo, however it routinely disconnects and is real pain to get reconnected. You have to delete it from your wink app then re set it up from scratch each time, ive had to do this 4-5 times over a few month period.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: These things are a lifesaver. Easy to setup and allows me to control time sensitive applications in my home. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Watts

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I use this along with an Echo Dot to turn my window AC on/off. Works like a charm. The Wink app sometimes doesn't get the current state of the outlet correct (whether it is on or off) but waiting a few seconds or switching to a different menu in the app and back seems to fix it. This doesn't bother me really because I mostly use the Echo to turn it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy with it so far. I'm using it with my wink hub and Amazon Echo, they work great. I'm using it with my Christmas lights so I can tell Alexa to turn them on and off :) Can be a little tricky to get it initially connected to your Hub/Wifi but once that is done it works awesome, only have to go through that once
customer_reviews.author: George Y.

customer_reviews.title: This works really well. I tried the belkin wireless ...
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I tried the belkin wireless outlet but the signal wasn't as strong. This works in the garage and the wireless router is in the house. It works quickly and simply. It also has two wirelessly controlled outlets vs the single one the belkin provides.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great home automation tool.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked perfect. (6 months). I use a combination of Amazon Echo and IFTTT to control each outlet with a custom phrase to control two different lamps. It has its own IFTTT channel. I recently purchased a wink hub and It works great with the hub as well. Setup was easy with an IPhone. Its a very inexpensive way to add a little automation to your home.
customer_reviews.author: Okone1

customer_reviews.title: Requires wink service
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great for me over the years but require the Wink service to be usable which appears likely to be shutting down. Don't be a sucker.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well - is just much bigger than I expected. Extremely sturdy and durable -- very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: PamM

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Bought to control with Alexa but could not setup. Setup to Wink works fine. I tried to pair with Alexa and could not find new power strip. Tried to find any instructions/videos but all say to find new device with Alexa app and that never found anything. Wish it worked as this is a nicely built power strip but will not work with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Supported By Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Not supported by Alexa!! Bought this power strip under the impression it would work with Alexa since it is advertised as such however it will not connect to Alexa. When I called the company to get help to connect it the rep. told me that it's no longer supported by Alexa. Another thing I didn't like is that when I tried setting timmers for Wink to turn the power on/off it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: George Perez jr.

customer_reviews.title: This is a remote controlled power strip not smart home strip.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is software issue but I can not get it to be universal on all devices (iphones) connected to the wink hub account. Me and my wife use the same wink hub with different emails and we are able to control lights via phone or alexa. This strip does not allow that functionality.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great, especially at the 20 dollar price point. The 2 Zwave outlets can be controlled independently and named seperately as well. The only drawback is that Alexa can find some of them to control and some of them not so much. I don't know why exactly. Overall though, these can't be beat for the current price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best deal for smart outlets.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third strip to buy. I have not had a problem connecting these or with them staying connected. These are definitely the best value on the market as you not only get one smart plug, but two, along with two standard plugs. I love these and will continue to buy from quirky
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: I'm super impressed with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm super impressed with this. For approximately $21 you get to smart plugs and it works flawlessly with the Wink Hub 2. Pairing it was interesting but not difficult. I've got a light and camera (not wink compatible camera) on this power strip and can turn them on and off as I like.
customer_reviews.author: Andrianna

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to add remote functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have several Quirky products and I've been pleased with this wifi enabled power strip. I bought it as a way to remotely turn on lamps in one room. However, I have repurposed it several times to control my CrockPot. It could be used for all kinds of remote control functionality.
customer_reviews.author: johnpmartin

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed of good materials but unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed of good materials but unreliable. After a few attempts to set up and use, decided it was just not dependable and too much trouble to use. The last straw was having to move furniture to get to it for setting up the link each time, when the whole point was to control power to a bunch of A/V components. Luckily Amazon return policy is great.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add a wireless controlled plug. WORKS Great with ALEXA.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Quirky Plug! Works with WINK products and ALEXA. Adds the ability to control devices from your phone. Works with most anything. Simple setup. Two (2) plugs are controllable by the WINK APP (IOS & ANDROID). Two (2) plugs are standard. Wink plugs can be turned on or off via the power strip. Can be used with ITTT, Alexa, Wink Hub!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey - N0RAH

customer_reviews.title: Superlative product.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product; it’s a shame that it has been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Broido

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with Alexa anymore. Manufacturer still advertising it, although the manufacturer stated they no longer work with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up. Buyers should note that only 2 of the plugs are "smart" meaning that it can be controlled on smart phone or Alexa. After I got it, the price went up. I will likely buy more of the price comes down again.
customer_reviews.author: Kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Great - bought 2 more!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best. Rather than buying a $300+ Air Conditioner I decided on this. I was worried about it having the power to run a 12,000 BTU ac unit but man did it work great. I have it powering both a high powered fan and AC unit which I can turn on from anywhere I have the WINK application!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I like this item ok
customer_reviews.text: I like this item ok, but it malfunctions constantly. My other smart home outlet items don't have anywhere near the problems this one does. It's such a great idea in theory, but practically there are too many problems for it to be reliable and thus useful in any real way. Maybe they can fix the issues soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kate H

customer_reviews.title: but I love it. Nabbed it at the $20 sale price ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this product, but I love it. Nabbed it at the $20 sale price and it is a great way to start my home automation! I was hesitant with some of the reviews, but I think there must have been an update that fixed all of the problems. The set up took a few tries, but when I got it connected with my android nexus 6p, it worked great! I have no problems with turning it on and off, or using it with IFTTT. The strip looks a little dorky, but works so well!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L.

customer_reviews.title: Work with Wink Hub (even offline)
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these outlets with my Wink Hub. Paring and be a bit tricky sometimes with the wink app but it'll generally work the second or third try. I love these outlets since they work even when my wink hub is not connected. Only wish the whole strip was wifi enabled!
customer_reviews.author: cds

customer_reviews.title: Quirky (no pun intended).
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product for all of my Christmas lights. A little quirky (no pun intended). The 2nd programmable outlet shut off when the 1st is turing on. You can program this to happen, however, I created no such program.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, and barely even works as a regular ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, and barely even works as a regular extension outlet. Only 1 of the 4 sockets work, none of the smart/Alexa features work.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Quirky/Wink Power Cord
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Wink hub user for almost three years and the connected items keep getting better. This power cord serves its purpose, I don't need that many smart outlets where I have it, so I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to reset
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars, but for some reason it showed up as offline in my Wink app after day 1. It was easy to reset, and with all Wink compatible products I usually need to reset the product and then disconnect from power before adding back. It hasn't gone offline since that first day. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: works with wink phone app. not with tablets.
customer_reviews.text: Works with wink software, no hub needed, wont set up with tablet , must use a phone for setup, afterwards you can control with Alexa and wink app.
customer_reviews.author: William Hurwitz

customer_reviews.title: Drops Wifi All the Time. Not Ready for Primetime.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product as an idea but I am having MAJOR issue keeping it connected to wifi. It's 10 feet away from the wifi router and drop the connection 40% of the time. I will return and replace with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm happy with this item. If you're using this for a lamp, it will only allow you to turn it on and off-- it will not dim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This device does NOT work with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to use with Alexa, and as per the most recent reviews and my own experience, the integration no longer exists. I went to great lengths to resolve the issue, but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: William N.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I love the Wink system and team. If you use IFTTT, you can even set up shortcuts to turn on/off the outlets based on circumstances. I have an Amazon Echo, and I can say "Alexa, trigger Christmas Tree on" to turn on outlet #1 where my tree is. Setup was quick and easy. Will likely purchase more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Audrina Andrews

customer_reviews.title: I guess I was a fool to buy these
customer_reviews.text: I had rated these 5 stars until the email I received where Wink thinks I am going to pay monthly to keep them. Thanks but no thanks. If they won’t work as regular power strips from now on, they will go in the trash. Tired of buying products from poorly run companies (quirky, wink). Goodby Wink
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It's a must have for Alexa users. Convenient and at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: all awesome and for an extremely value oriented price
customer_reviews.text: If you even have an inkling, thought, pause or rumination about these buggers - DO NOT WAIT - BUY IT. I have four, all awesome and for an extremely value oriented price. You can not argue with a good product. Life is good.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Works with Echo Dot. No hub required!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a few weeks ago, and finally set it up today. I connected the Quirky Pivot Power Genius to WiFi via the Wink app. Then, I enabled the Wink skill on my Echo Dot via the Alexa app. I discovered the device, and changed one of the outlet names to “lamp” in the Alexa app. Finally, I plugged my lamp into the smart outlet and said, “Alexa, turn on the lamp.” Works like a charm! No hub required! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. If you need zwave power strip with a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. If you need zwave power strip with a couple of outlets this might be the only game it town right now. I use it with the Wink hub and seem to work very well. Have not had any issues with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: cltambo

customer_reviews.title: Needless to say, this product works and is needed. Build quaity is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Ultra useful. Excellent build quality and design. I have bought it three times. I have started to hate those straight power bars. This is the new standard.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian_buyer

customer_reviews.title: Forget about all the negative reviews, it works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on buying this item after seeing all the negative reviews. I decided to buy it and I haven't had any issues with it so far. It's been a month since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: quit working after 9 months. always on the blink ...
customer_reviews.text: quit working after 9 months. always on the blink, having to reset. was told by Wink the company who makes them went out of business. I want another, tho...will purchase protection plan and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: lwcomer

customer_reviews.title: This is the most cost effective option for two smart outlets, and at around $25
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze, and syncs directly with Alexa. This is the most cost effective option for two smart outlets, and at around $25, it's about the same cost as a "dumb" power strip. After trying it out, I bought 5 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anyone trying to save energy
customer_reviews.text: must have outlet. Helps save energy by being able to shot off two plugs with an app.
customer_reviews.author: evoe

customer_reviews.title: Poor compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Only works if you have the wink hub. No direct compatibility with any other smart thing hub.
customer_reviews.author: michael carney

customer_reviews.title: Reccomend for amazon Alexa Echo
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up currently to a heater and a fan. It works grrat with Alexa. I bought this because it was one of the only ones I could find with more than one outlet and for a good price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: ... before purchasing the WEMO plug - this thing is fantastic and gives you two plugs to control at a ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had found this guy before purchasing the WEMO plug - this thing is fantastic and gives you two plugs to control at a lower price point than the WEMO. setup was really easy with a nice app interface and I have this working like a charm with my Google Home using the IFTTT integration.
customer_reviews.author: David Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Echo
customer_reviews.text: This strip is cool and the app does work, but my whole purpose for purchasing was that it claimed to work with the Echo, which it does not.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Go Quirky Go!
customer_reviews.text: Another great quirky product. I use this one to remote control and schedule a ceiling fan and phone charger to power on\off based on a schedule and also on using a GoControl motion sensor. It's a great combination.
customer_reviews.author: Snapperheadjoe

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. Program to your smart phone and you never have to touch your lamps again.
customer_reviews.author: Anne R.

customer_reviews.title: Setup is easy. Works fine with Alexa no hub needed - ...
customer_reviews.text: A little unreliable as far as responding to commands quicky, but it does work well overall. Setup is easy. Works fine with Alexa no hub needed - doesn't work with Google Assistant.
customer_reviews.author: cmgenius

customer_reviews.title: The device is great. The app (wink) for it though wont let ...
customer_reviews.text: The device is great. The app (wink) for it though wont let me schedule events with this unit. I can only use the app to turn on and off the app as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried to sync with wink hub over 3 days with ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried to sync with wink hub over 3 days with help of customer service. Used two iPhones and an iPad with no luck. Will return
customer_reviews.author: V Wiggz

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I will buy another one eventually. Works great with Alexa. I keep my electric blanket and phone charger in the switches you can toggle on and off. Wasn't hard to set up, I have a Wink hub, the first, older one.
customer_reviews.author: Julia K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Wink !
customer_reviews.text: Love this- works perfectly with my Wink hub. Was easy to set up and I've used the middle plugs (the ones you are able to control with the Wink app) to control my Christmas lights and tree topper this holiday season.
customer_reviews.author: Nobo323

customer_reviews.title: works great. I did not read the ad too well ...
customer_reviews.text: works great. I did not read the ad too well as this can control lights from an app on your phone which I did not want or need otherwise it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Girard

customer_reviews.title: Love these...wish they still made them.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Power Plug. It hooks to my wink system, and they work great. Very durable, and have held up great. To bad they dont make anymore or I would get more.
customer_reviews.author: Schpeen

customer_reviews.title: Returned...It wouldn't connect to WINK or Logitech hubs
customer_reviews.text: I thought others just got a bad unit..Yeah, looks like these are just junk. They just don't connect to smart hubs...
customer_reviews.author: JAL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good device and was shipped in nice package fast. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. The setup really isn't too difficult if you follow the directions (took me less than 2mins to have it connected to my wifi router with WPA2).
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: I love these. Takes a couple of tries to set ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Takes a couple of tries to set up with wink. They are pretty larger, larger than a standard surge protector strip. Perfect to automate lamps around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value!
customer_reviews.text: You get TWO switchable outlets for this price! And it's a GE product. Everything sets up in seconds with the Wink app, and it works with Alexa after enabling the Wink skill. Yes, the plug isn't "compact", but it's because there's a lot of wiring required for two switchable outlets and two regular outlets to all be in the same device.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

product_meta.title: Pivot Power Genius Power Strip
product_meta.description: Pivot Power Genius is an app-enabled version of our best-selling power strip. Like the original, it bends to fit every sized plug or adapter without wasting a single outlet. This one puts the power at your fingertips, allowing you to independently control two outlets from your mobile device. You'll never wonder if you've left your lamp on at home again!
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (hub required, Alexa device and hub sold separately).
Smart technology - Turn two outlets on or off remotely from an app on your mobile device. This can be manual or scheduled automatically from anywhere at anytime
Outlet party - Four pivoting outlets accommodate plugs and adapters of all shapes and sizes. That means you can always fill every outlet; even those big ol' AC bricks are welcome
Surge protection - No sparks! Unwanted spikes in voltage don't stand a chance against Pivot Power Genius's 1080 joules of rock-solid surge protection
Turn two outlets on or off remotely from an app on your mobile device. This can be manual or scheduled automatically from anywhere at anytime.
Four pivoting outlets accommodate plugs and adapters of all shapes and sizes.
No sparks! Unwanted spikes in voltage don't stand a chance against Pivot Power Genius's 1080 joules of rock-solid surge protection.
